channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- SmartCloud Analytics
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- SmartCloud Analytics

item.title: CVE-2019-4214|2024-08-04T19:33:36.912Z -- ibm -- smartcloud%20analytics
item.description: IBM SmartCloud Analytics 1.3.1 through 1.3.5 does not set the secure attribute on authorization tokens or session cookies. This could allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information using man in the middle techniques. IBM X-Force ID: 159185.

item.title: CVE-2019-4216|2024-08-04T19:33:37.615Z -- ibm -- smartcloud%20analytics
item.description: IBM SmartCloud Analytics 1.3.1 through 1.3.5 is vulnerable to possible host header injection attack that could lead to HTTP cache poisoning or firewall bypass. IBM X-Force ID: 159187.

item.title: CVE-2019-4244|2024-08-04T19:33:37.787Z -- ibm -- smartcloud%20analytics
item.description: IBM SmartCloud Analytics 1.3.1 through 1.3.5 could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized information and unrestricted control over Zookeeper installations due to missing authentication. IBM X-Force ID: 159518.

item.title: CVE-2019-4243|2024-08-04T19:33:37.556Z -- ibm -- smartcloud%20analytics
item.description: IBM SmartCloud Analytics 1.3.1 through 1.3.5 allows unauthorized disclosure of information like accessing solrconfig.xml and could allow an attacker to perform disruptive administrator tasks. IBM X-Force ID: 159517.

item.title: CVE-2019-4215|2024-08-04T19:33:37.620Z -- ibm -- smartcloud%20analytics
item.description: IBM SmartCloud Analytics 1.3.1 through 1.3.5 could allow a remote attacker to hijack the clicking action of the victim. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to hijack the victim's click actions and possibly launch further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 159186.
